results.title: Interviewing and hiring: getting it right the first time
results.creator_credit: Peter Campbell, The Public Record and Clifton Hill Productions
results.brief_description: The importance of selecting the right person for the job and the implications to your business if you don’t are highlighted in this 30 minute video. The 4 classic mistakes that hirers make - failure to fully read and understand the candidate’s CV, poor questioning techniques in the interview, excessive talking by the interviewer, and inadequate verification with previous employers - are clearly explained by presenter Sandy Kaye and illustrated through live footage. Covers issues such as job titles, exaggerated claims, education and training, references and testimonials and the importance of open and behavioural questioning. A complimentary participants guide accompanies the video which allows pausing between each mistake addressed. Whilst aimed at employers/interviewers this video is equally useful for job seekers who want to know how to conduct oneself in an interview. Written by Bruce Storey.

results.title: Interview with Linus Pauling
results.creator_credit: Joseph Koenig, Hugh O'Connor and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A stimulating and provocative hour with Dr. Linus Pauling, eminent American chemist and Nobel Prize winner in 1954 (Chemistry). A man of good humor, conviction and far-reaching enthusiasm, Dr. Pauling speaks in this film of his work in biochemistry, in which he is considered to be one of the world’s leading authorities, of his opposition to atomic explosions, and of his concern for the future of man.

results.title: Interview with Christopher Doyle
results.brief_description:
Australian cinematographer Christopher Doyle talks about how time operates in his filmmaking, how life experience has shaped his work, the role of repetition, structure and movement in cinematogrpahy, how space informs and influences his technique, and about the collaborative process of filmmaking.
Includes clips from ‘Paranoid Park’ 2007; ‘Days of Being Wild’ (A Fei zheng chuan), 1990; ‘Happy Together’ (Chun gwong cha sit), 1997; ‘In the Mood for Love’ (Fa yeung nin wa), 2000; and ‘Fallen Angels’ (Duo luo tian shi), 1995.

results.title: Interview with Ben Whitham
results.brief_description: In war, you are discouraged from keeping records or taking photographs. However, soldiers broke those rules in order to help remember. Born on a small soldier’s settlement farm, Ben Witham grew up hearing stories about the war. Having a father who served in Gallipoli, to his own service in World War II, Witham recalls the camaraderie and the lighter side of war. He emphasises the bonds of fellow servicemen and the celebration of this during commemorations for ANZACs.

results.title: Interview with a vampire: the vampire chronicles (S)
results.creator_credit: Neil Jordan, Stephen Woolley, David Geffen and Geffen Pictures
results.brief_description: The first of Anne Rice’s “Vampire Chronicles” was brought to the screen by Neil Jordan. Despite initial public misgivings, Tom Cruise is convincingly seductive and evil as the Vampire Lestat. Brad Pitt plays Louis, the narrator of the strange history of his journey into immortality as a vampire. These two are ably supported by an all star cast including Christian Slater, Antonio Banderas, Kirsten Dunst and Stephen Rea. Jordan’s film is visually striking and sensual; so much so that the viewer is often torn between a world full of blood and horror and the allurement of immortality and the supernatural.

results.title: Interview game: Body language
results.brief_description: Gestures, facial expressions and posture are non-verbal ways of communicating feelings and attitude. How to read and react to body language is the subject of this video. It promotes the kind of people skills needed when conducting or going for a job interview. Factors contributing to successful inteviews which are covered include: preparation, location of the interview, placement of the furniture, note taking and speech patterns.
